segments.text: Have you thought of moving at all , Sarah ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: We ’ Ve thought about it , but my husband and I can ’ t afford it right now . The only thing we could afford would be living in the slums , which is something I don ’ t want to do .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Buying a house can be expensive , but there are ways to find cheaper houses .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , sometimes the city auctions offer houses to the community . You ’ d have to make a quick decision about the offer in a day , but you would definitely save money doing it that way .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That ’ s a good idea . Do you know anyone who has done that before ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Sure , my sister-in-law and her husband just bought a house that way . They ’ re pretty satisfied with it .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Not at all . The woman , who owned it , took good care of it . But when she died , she had no family left and no will , so the government had to sell it for her .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Was it a very old house ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It was about 75 years old . There were a few repairs that needed doing , but it didn ’ t take a lot of money or time .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Is it in a good location ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: The area can be a bit rough in the evenings , but the neighbors watch out for each other , so it ’ s ok .
segments.speaker: S1
